page.title: 11EDUCATION FOXDELL SCH. LUTON
page.content: Foxdell Junior school has an upper and a lower part. They have little gardens outside each classroom. They have a little compartment for nature and other things to do with the countryside. The classrooms have tables instead of desks. The classrooms are on two sides of the hall and a kitchen is on another. Between the classrooms are libraries one has a shop in it. In the cloakrooms there are sinks, with paints and clay. At playtime the 144 children have to go up a slope to the playground. There are about 20 species of tree along the side of the field and playground. The field goes up to the edge of the M1 motorway, this might be dangerous if a lorry came off onto the children. In the staff room are settees they were hard. There was also a kiln for making the pottery hard, a red light shines when it is on.
